resources.string: Need help?\nClick here to view the tutorial.
Start tutorial
Do you want to start the tutorial?

Hey! \nThis is a short tutorial on how to get started with NextTask. \nPress the \">\" in the bottom right corner to continue or press the \"X\" in the bottom left corner to quit. If you want to see the tutorial again, just shake your device!
Nice, let\'s get started! Press the \"+\" in the upper right corner and add your first task.\n\n
Good job! \nNow, what can you do with tasks? Try pressing it to find out.

Tasks are things you have to do. This is the detailed overview of a tasks. You can write descriptions, set a due date and add reminders. When a task is overdue, it will appear red in the list of tasks. Also, all its parent folders will have a small \"!\" on them, so that you easily can find overdue tasks.
Now try setting a due date. Press the marked element and select a date.
Great! Next, try adding a reminder. There are custom reminders and reminders relative to the due date. You can set as many reminders as you wish.
Nice, you are starting to get a hang of this. See the title at the top of the screen? Try tapping it to change the name of this task. Then, press the check mark to save the new name.
Well, now you know how tasks work. Go back to learn about more of NextTask\'s awesome features. You can either swipe right or press the back button in the upper left corner.
Okay, now we\'re back at the overview. Tap the circle to the left of a task.

Nice, that\'s how you check a task. It means that you have completed it. If you press it again, it gets unchecked. Tap the star to the right of a task. The star symbolizes that the item is prioritized.

Awesome, you have now mastered tasks. But just listing tasks will get messy pretty fast. We need something to group them in. What about folders? Yeah, they seem like a good idea. Instead of pressing the \"+\", hold your finger on it, and drag it down. That\'s a faster way to add folders.
Cool, adding items that way was much faster. Now, press on the folder to see its content.
Okay, this is an empty folder. In folders, you group items. You can have as many nested folders as you like.
Well, an empty folder is kinda boring, don\'t you think? Try adding a note to it. Hold your finger over the \"+\" again, but this time, drag to the middle, over the pen icon.
Good job! That\'s how a note is added. If you want, you can of course add all the items by tapping the \"+\" and selecting what type you want to add. Now press the note you just created!
Alright, so this is a note. A note is basically just an empty writing space. You can write down anything you\'d like; ideas, cool quotes you\'ve heard or whatever you want.
Speaking of writing down stuff, try it for yourself! Just tap the gray area and write something. When you are done, press the checkmark in the upper right corner to save your changes.
Amazing! Now you also know how notes and folders work. Go back to the folder where the task was and I\'ll show you some more features.
To remove, move and group items, there is a set of powerful tools. To be able to use them, hold a finger down on any item in the list.

That wasn\'t hard, was it? Now you are in the options mode. By tapping items, you can toggle and untoggle them. If you perform a bulk action, all the selected items will be affected. You can also reorder individual items by dragging them around. Just grab them in those three lines on their right side. Try it out!
Cool, that went great! Now, to remove an item, you select it and press the trash can. Press the \">\" to learn about the next action.

Okay, the next action is a bit more complicated. If you press it, you group the selected items in a new folder. All you have to do is naming the new folder. This comes in handy when you have to organize lots of tasks.
Alright, the next button selects and unselects all the items in the list.

What if you want to move something? Well, that\'s what the next action is for. You simply choose what folder you want to move your items to. You can also move folders to the menu, which we\'ll get to in a minute.

Alright, you should know everything about the actions in the option mode now. Hold your finger over an item again to disable return to the normal view. You can also use the back button on your device to do this.
We\'re almost done. Do you remember the menu i mentioned earlier? Well, that\'s what you will learn to use now. Simply swipe right or press the menu button in the upper left corner to see it!

Ohh, it\'s so beautiful, isn\'t it? This is the menu, the top of the hierarchy. At the bottom there are two buttons, one for adding folders in the menu, and the other one for viewing the settings. In the folder list, you can also enable options, just as you did with the other ones. Remember? Just hold your finger over an item.
Good job! Now to the final part of this tutorial, the settings! Press the settings button at the bottom of the menu. It\'s the button with a gear icon.
In the settings you can to lots of different things; change theme, language, how to sort your items and much more. Try changing the theme.

Ohh, this new theme looks so sexy. The colors match great, don't you think? 

Well, this was it for this tutorial. I hoped you learned alot about NextTask and will use it to organize your life. If you have any questions, please contact us through the feedback form here in the settings. 

Good luck!
